ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

My illness will last a short time
Notes: Item is reverse-scored. 1=Strongly disagree; 2=Disagree; 3=Neither agree nor disagree; 4=Agree; 5=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: My illness is likely to be permanent rather than temporary
My illness will last for a long time
This illness will pass quickly
Notes: Item is reverse-scored. 1=Strongly disagree; 2=Disagree; 3=Neither agree nor disagree; 4=Agree; 5=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I expect to have this illness for the rest of my life
My illness will improve in time
Notes: Item is reverse-scored. 1=Strongly disagree; 2=Disagree; 3=Neither agree nor disagree; 4=Agree; 5=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: The symptoms of my illness change a great deal from day to day
My symptoms come and go in cycles
My illness is very unpredictable
I go through cycles in which my illness gets better and worse
My illness is a serious condition
My illness has major consequences on my life
My illness does not have much effect on my life
Notes: Item is reverse-scored. 1=Strongly disagree; 2=Disagree; 3=Neither agree nor disagree; 4=Agree; 5=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: My illness strongly affects the way others see me
My illness has serious financial consequences
My illness causes difficulties for those who are close to me
There is a lot which I can do to control my symptoms
What I do can determine whether my illness gets better or worse
The course of my illness depends on me
Nothing I do will affect my illness
Notes: Item is reverse-scored. 1=Strongly disagree; 2=Disagree; 3=Neither agree nor disagree; 4=Agree; 5=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I have the power to influence my illness
My actions will have no affect on the outcome of my illness
Notes: Item is reverse-scored. 1=Strongly disagree; 2=Disagree; 3=Neither agree nor disagree; 4=Agree; 5=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: There is very little that can be done to improve my illness
Notes: Item is reverse-scored. 1=Strongly disagree; 2=Disagree; 3=Neither agree nor disagree; 4=Agree; 5=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: My treatment will be effective in curing my illness
The negative effects of my illness can be prevented (avoided) by my treatment
My treatment can control my illness
There is nothing which can help my condition
Notes: Item is reverse-scored. 1=Strongly disagree; 2=Disagree; 3=Neither agree nor disagree; 4=Agree; 5=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: The symptoms of my condition are puzzling to me
Notes: Item is reverse-scored. 1=Strongly disagree; 2=Disagree; 3=Neither agree nor disagree; 4=Agree; 5=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: My illness is a mystery to me
Notes: Item is reverse-scored. 1=Strongly disagree; 2=Disagree; 3=Neither agree nor disagree; 4=Agree; 5=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I don't understand my illness
Notes: Item is reverse-scored. 1=Strongly disagree; 2=Disagree; 3=Neither agree nor disagree; 4=Agree; 5=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: My illness doesn't make any sense to me
Notes: Item is reverse-scored. 1=Strongly disagree; 2=Disagree; 3=Neither agree nor disagree; 4=Agree; 5=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I have a clear picture or understanding of my condition
I get depressed when I think about my illness
When I think about my illness I get upset
My illness makes me feel angry
My illness does not worry me
Notes: Item is reverse-scored. 1=Strongly disagree; 2=Disagree; 3=Neither agree nor disagree; 4=Agree; 5=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Having this illness makes me feel anxious
My illness makes me feel afraid
